Reason: The 'bucket.size' configuration option is performance-sensitive. This is because the 'bucket.size' configuration directly affects the number of buckets in each direction, which in turn impacts the computation of anti-aliasing stepping sizes and contrast thresholds. These computations involve time-expensive operations such as clamping values, computing subpixel sizes, and generating QMC sampling tables. The 'bucket.size' configuration also influences the resolution of the image and the number of buckets, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Therefore, the 'bucket.size' configuration is considered performance-sensitive based on its impact on performance-related operations within the code context.
